arts.ttl: Professional performance earns three vital points for Barca against the odds
arts.sum: Whilst it’s true that Sevilla hadn’t beaten Barca in La Liga since 2015, the Blaugranes had shown with their results against the likes of Las Palmas and Leganes this season that they were there for the taking if the opposition were up to the task. Pedri created five chances from open play against Sevilla, his joint-most in a LaLiga game for Barcelona.

arts.ttl: Barca fear Araujo will be out for three weeks with sprained ankle
arts.sum: Barcelona fear Ronald Araujo suffered a sprained ankle against Sevilla on Sunday and will be out of action for around three weeks. Araujo was spotted on the bench with an ice pack on his ankle and will now undergo further tests on the injury.

arts.ttl: Flick gives his verdict on Fermin’s red card against Sevilla
arts.sum: Flick was also happy to see his team take three points which cuts the gap to league leaders Real Madrid. In the second half especially, with one less player, we fought to get the three points,” he added.

arts.ttl: Sevilla 1-4 Barcelona: Player Ratings as Barca Get Within Two Points of Real Madrid in La Liga Title Race
arts.sum: Barcelona took advantage of Real Madrid and Atlético Madrid dropping points to get even closer to the top spot in La Liga.

arts.ttl: ‘We are very much alive’ - Inigo sends out strong message after Barca win
arts.sum: If we remain confident and firm at the back, we all know what our forwards are capable of up front. Inigo Martinez was a happy man after seeing Barcelona beat Sevilla 4-1 to cut the gap on league leaders Real Madrid to two points.

arts.ttl: Gavi explains why Flick took him off at half-time at Sevilla
arts.sum: The midfielder started the game but was booked and looked to be struggling physically in the first half. “We are very happy with the game.

The blaugranes' German coach was in a good mood talking after the win in the Sánchez-Pizjuán: "I am really happy with our performance; we played really well and we fought for the three points." One of the most satisfying things for the Barça was the performance of his team with 10 men.

arts.ttl: Barcelona storm past Sevilla to close La Liga title gap
arts.sum: Barcelona are chasing down their La Liga title rivals once again after a 4-1 win on the road at Sevilla. At the end of the weekend’s action, Barcelona are now just one point behind second place Atletico Madrid, and two behind leaders Real Madrid. A 1-1 draw in the Madrid derby opened the door for […] The post Barcelona storm past Sevilla to close La Liga title gap appeared first on Football España.

arts.ttl: 10-man Barça beat Sevilla, close gap on Madrid
arts.sum: Barcelona earned a hard-fought 4-1 home win at struggling Sevilla on Sunday thanks to goals by Robert Lewandowski, Fermin Lopez, Raphinha and Eric Garcia to edge them closer to the top of the LaLiga standings.

arts.ttl: Barcelona star to miss Rayo Vallecano clash through suspension
arts.sum: La Liga giants Barcelona have on Sunday evening been dealt a 2nd blow on the personnel front. This comes owing to developments in the club’s latest outing. Barcelona of course…
